definition: to become exhausted
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
rope/to bind together/to twist around
surname Lei
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: Alina was tired, and cold, and sad.
I was working 70 hours this week. I'm totfriend maxed out.
sentences.chinese: 我这星期工作70个小时，我真累坏了。

sentences.english: That is a long flight. You had a layover too, is that right? You must be tired.
sentences.chinese: 路程真是不近。中途还有短暂停留吧？您一定累坏了。

sentences.english: I'm fagged out after all that gardening.
sentences.chinese: 在园中干完那么多活后，我累坏了。

sentences.english: I was exhausted after buzzing around for a whole day.
sentences.chinese: 一整天东奔西跑的，把我累坏了。

sentences.english: 'I get really tired when I sit all day, ' Ms. Jones Brown said.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯布朗说，当我整天坐着的时候我真的累坏了。

sentences.english: I am absolutely knackered after working all day.
sentences.chinese: 工作一天之后我都累坏了。

sentences.english: The summer heat made me feel pooped out.
sentences.chinese: 夏季的炎热使我感到累坏了。

sentences.english: I am burned out after the ling walk .
sentences.chinese: 走了这么长的路后，我累坏了。

sentences.english: I am really pooped right now.
ZZ is exhausted, even a game from his favorite soccer team can not keep him awake. Poor Baby!
sentences.chinese: ZZ累坏了，连最喜欢看的足球赛都没法让他醒过来。

sentences.english: A：I was working 70 hours this week. I’m totally maxed out.
sentences.chinese: 我这星期工作70个小时，我真累坏了。

sentences.english: I was working 70 hours this week. I'm totasly maxed out.
sentences.chinese: 我这星期劳动70个小时，我真累坏了。

sentences.english: We were tired out after that long walk.
sentences.chinese: 走了那么长一段路，我们都累坏了。

definition: to collapse/to be worn out/to break down
unbearable/terrible/enough/unlikely
tired to the point of dropping
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
rope/to bind together/to twist around
surname Lei
to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
to have a rest/to stay for the night/to go to bed/to sleep
to be unable to tolerate or endure/to find sth difficult to manage
variant of 夠嗆|够呛[gou4 qiang4]
posture/upright posture
to wake sb up
to take it easy
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
to lie down
to tire/tired
